popUpDatum.title: Beam Me Up ATCA Tutorial
popUpDatum.content: Your mission is to observe Betelguese

popUpDatum.title: Meet The Engineer
popUpDatum.content:
The engineer is one of two playable classes in Beam Me Up ATCA.

One of their main jobs is to keep the array running smoothly

popUpDatum.title: Unit Health
popUpDatum.content:
Each structure has a health bar that gradually drops in value.

As it drops it will negatively affect the performance of a structure.

For telescopes, it reduces the quality of a scan resulting in lower score.

popUpDatum.title: Repair
popUpDatum.content:
When it drops low enough, the array icons in the bottom right will start changing colours

Note the state of the icons now.

If they are not green, in order to fix the array you must left click the engineer, then use the (default: 3) key while hovering over the array to mend it.

popUpDatum.title: Repair Times
popUpDatum.content: Repairing structures take time! Any engineer occupied with fixing a dish can't do anything else until the dish is fixed.

popUpDatum.title: Rail System
popUpDatum.content:
The telescopes aren't static, they need to move along these rails. Note that the rails are also damaged.

The more damaged the rails, the slower the telescopes move when being moved to a new configuration.

You fix them the same way you fix arrays.

popUpDatum.title: Unit Morale
popUpDatum.content:
Note that the engineer also has a similar health bar. This is their morale. The lower a player’s morale,

the slower they perform tasks around the array. To refill their morale, they need to rest. 

To do this, they need to go into town for a break.

popUpDatum.title: Restoring Morale
popUpDatum.content: To restore a units morale, you left click the unit, right click the bus stop and select 'Rest in town'

popUpDatum.title: Meet the Scientist
popUpDatum.content:
Lets meet the scientist.

Scientists can be sent to the observation room to keep a closer eye on the array.

While there is a character in the observation room, you get more points when completing a scan.

To do this, left click the scientist, press (default: 1) while hovering over the observation station.

popUpDatum.title: Stationing Units
popUpDatum.content: When a player is stationed in a building, a player icon shifts to indicate which building the unit is in.

popUpDatum.title: The Weather Station
popUpDatum.content:
The weather is looking grim. We should head to the Weather Station to keep an eye on things.

To do this select the scientist icon in the bottom left, then press (default: 1) while hovering over the Weather Station.

Whilst there is a character observing in the Weather Station, you will get extra time to prepare for inclement conditions when a weather warning is issued.

popUpDatum.title: Unit Return
popUpDatum.content: Upon unit return from relaxing activities in town they will have a fully replenished morale bar

popUpDatum.title: Radio Interference
popUpDatum.content:
Sometimes tourists continue to use their mobile phone on site.

Mobile phones emit radio signals which play havoc with radio telescope observations!

You need to tell tourists such as these to turn off their phone. Left click the engineer, then right click the tourist and select “Confiscate Phone”.

popUpDatum.title: Weather - High Winds
popUpDatum.content:
A storm is coming! High wind can damage the array and dishes need to be stowed.

Luckily, when there is a scientist observing in the Weather Station and we have some extra time to prepare.

To do this, left click the engineer, then press: (default: 6) while hovering your cursor over the array

popUpDatum.title: Multi Unit Commands
popUpDatum.content:
You have more engineers at your disposal and we should put them to use!

To do this left click multiple engineers at a time then hover over a telescope and select 'Stow'.

popUpDatum.title: Morale Loss (Storms)
popUpDatum.content:
During storms you must get your engineers inside! They lose morale faster if they get caught in a storm.

Left click and engineer, right click any building and select 'Hunker Down' after you right click on the Shed,

Observation Room, or Weather Station.

popUpDatum.title: Weather (Lightning)
popUpDatum.content:
There is another danger that storms present to the array; A lightning strike can cut the power supply to the array.

To fix this you must left click any engineer icon above a building then right click the shed and select 'Activate Generators'.

popUpDatum.title: Array Configuration
popUpDatum.content:
In order to observe different targets the array must be reconfigured. Individual dishes will need to be moved to align 

with different junction boxes. All dishes need to be stowed before they can be moved. To do this click on any engineer icon, then press (default: 6) while hovering over a dish.

Do this for all the dishes.

popUpDatum.title: Array Movements
popUpDatum.content:
Once all dishes are stowed, you can begin moving the arrays to get them to their correct junction box for the current configuration.

To move a dish, select an engineer and get them to enter the array you want to move. Then press (default: 4) while hovering over the empty slot you want to move to.

popUpDatum.title: Score & Observation Progress
popUpDatum.content:
Once the array is in the correct configuration and all array components are non critical, both your score and observation progress
will start increasing. We must be careful though and keep an eye on things to make sure the observation goes smoothly

popUpDatum.title: Tutorial Complete
popUpDatum.content:
Congragulations the tutorial is complete. Feel free to have a try practicing what you have learnt during this tutorial.

When you are ready, return to the main menu to explore other modes.
